an9.18:1.4.pli: ‘yāvajīvaṁ arahanto pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭiviratā nihitadaṇḍā nihitasatthā lajjī dayāpannā sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampino viharanti;
an9.18:1.4.en: ‘As long as they live, the perfected ones give up killing living creatures, renouncing the rod and the sword. They are [38;5;121mscrupulous and kind[0m, and live full of compassion for all living beings.

an9.18:1.5.pli: ahampajja imañca rattiṁ imañca divasaṁ pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharāmi.
an9.18:1.5.en: I, too, for this day and night will give up killing living creatures, renouncing the rod and the sword. I’ll be [38;5;121mscrupulous and kind[0m, and live full of compassion for all living beings.

an10.211:12.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati. #1
an10.211:12.3.en: It’s when a certain person gives up killing living creatures. They renounce the rod and the sword. They’re [38;5;121mscrupulous and kind[0m, living full of compassion for all living beings.

an10.212:3.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.

an10.176:25.2.pli: Idha, cunda, ekacco pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī dayāpanno, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati. #1
an10.176:25.2.en: It’s when a certain person gives up killing living creatures. They renounce the rod and the sword. They’re [38;5;121mscrupulous and kind[0m, living full of compassion for all living beings.

an4.198:8.1.pli: So evaṁ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṁ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.
an4.198:8.1.en: Once they’ve gone forth, they take up the training and livelihood of the mendicants. They give up killing living creatures, renouncing the rod and the sword. They’re [38;5;121mscrupulous and kind[0m, living full of compassion for all living beings.

mn41:12.2.pli: Idha, gahapatayo, ekacco pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.
mn41:12.2.en: It’s when a certain person gives up killing living creatures. They renounce the rod and the sword. They’re [38;5;121mscrupulous and kind[0m, living full of compassion for all living beings.

an10.99:11.1.pli: So evaṁ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṁ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.

mn112:13.2.pli: So evaṁ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṁ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato ahosiṁ nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī vihāsiṁ.
mn112:13.2.en: Once I had gone forth, I took up the training and livelihood of the mendicants. I gave up killing living creatures, renouncing the rod and the sword. I was [38;5;121mscrupulous and kind[0m, living full of compassion for all living beings.

mn135:6.1.pli: Idha pana, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.
mn135:6.1.en: But take some woman or man who gives up killing living creatures. They renounce the rod and the sword. They’re [38;5;121mscrupulous and kind[0m, living full of compassion for all living beings.

mn27:13.1.pli: So evaṁ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṁ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.
mn27:13.1.en: Once they’ve gone forth, they take up the training and livelihood of the mendicants. They give up killing living creatures, renouncing the rod and the sword. They’re [38;5;121mscrupulous and kind[0m, living full of compassion for all living beings.

dn8:18.6.pli: Idha, kassapa, bhikkhu pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.
dn8:18.6.en: It’s when a mendicant gives up killing living creatures. They renounce the rod and the sword. They’re [38;5;121mscrupulous and kind[0m, living full of compassion for all living beings.

mn101:32.1.pli: So evaṁ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṁ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.

mn114:5.14.pli: Idha, bhante, ekacco pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati;
mn114:5.14.en: It’s when someone gives up killing living creatures. They renounce the rod and the sword. They’re [38;5;121mscrupulous and kind[0m, living full of compassion for all living beings.

dn1:1.8.1.pli: ‘Pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato samaṇo gotamo nihitadaṇḍo, nihitasattho, lajjī, dayāpanno, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharatī’ti—
dn1:1.8.1.en: ‘The ascetic Gotama has given up killing living creatures. He has renounced the rod and the sword. He’s [38;5;121mscrupulous and kind[0m, living full of compassion for all living beings.’

dn2:43.2.pli: Idha, mahārāja, bhikkhu pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti. Nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.
dn2:43.2.en: It’s when a mendicant gives up killing living creatures, renouncing the rod and the sword. They’re [38;5;121mscrupulous and kind[0m, living full of compassion for all living beings.

mn38:33.1.pli: So evaṁ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṁ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.

dn30:1.10.2.pli: pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato ahosi nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī vihāsi.
dn30:1.10.2.en: He gave up killing living creatures, renouncing the rod and the sword. He was [38;5;121mscrupulous and kind[0m, living full of compassion for all living beings.
